content:
• Monday, March 18, 2013
  • HPT

    Hospitality Properties Trust (NYSE:HPT) announces a 10M share public offering. The company...

    Hospitality Properties Trust (NYSE:HPT) announces a 10M share public offering. The company expects to use the proceeds to pay down its outstanding unsecured revolving credit facility and for general business purposes. Morgan Stanley, BofA Merrill Lynch and Wells Fargo Securities are all acting as joint book runners. Shares -4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:03 PM
  • DELL-OLD

    Dell (DELL-OLD) gains 2.1% AH on word Blackstone may be part of a group mulling a bid for the...

    Dell (DELL-OLD) gains 2.1% AH on word Blackstone may be part of a group mulling a bid for the company. The P-E firm is among those who signed a non-disclosure agreement earlier this month, allowing it to get a close look at Dell's books.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:25 PM | 10 Comments
  • INTX

    More on Intersections (NASDAQ:INTX): Q4 earnings dropped sharply as the data security company...

    More on Intersections (NASDAQ:INTX): Q4 earnings dropped sharply as the data security company lost subscribers, and projects a downbeat revenue forecast for FY13 as well, due in part to a decline in sales to financial industry clients. For the current year, it now expects revenue to decrease by 10% to 15% compared with 2012, and its EPS to fall between 40% and 50%, reflecting higher marketing expenses and an increase in operating losses. Read more on earnings here: Earnings Call Transcript. Shares -15% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:22 PM
  • LULU

    Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) -5.6% AH after announcing a shortage in its supply of luon pants after...

    Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) -5.6% AH after announcing a shortage in its supply of luon pants after large shipments were deemed too see-through for its standards. LULU cuts its outlook, expecting Q1 comp-store sales to increase 5%-8%, resulting in Q1 revenues of $333M-$343M vs. prior guidance of $350M-$355M and analyst consensus of $354M.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:23 PM | 14 Comments
  • AFFY

    Shares of Affymax (OTC:AFFY) get slammed coming out of a trading halt in the post session after...

    Shares of Affymax (OTC:AFFY) get slammed coming out of a trading halt in the post session after issuing a dismal press release, saying it may never bring its anti-anemia Omontys drug back to market following February's recall. It's laid off 75% of its workforce and is exploring strategic options that include an asset sale and even potential bankruptcy. The company describes itself as essentially a company in transition from a commercial operating company, to a company potentially without any product. Shares -40% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:50 PM | 2 Comments
  • CCRN

    Cross Country (NASDAQ:CCRN): Q4 EPS of -$0.31 may not compare to consensus -$0.01. Revenue of...

    Cross Country (NASDAQ:CCRN): Q4 EPS of -$0.31 may not compare to consensus -$0.01. Revenue of $111.7M misses by $14.8M. Shares -3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • SKUL

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: SKUL +4%. FSL +4%. DRYS +4%. NOK +3%. FOSL +3%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: SKUL +4%. FSL +4%. DRYS +4%. NOK +3%. FOSL +3%.
    After-hours top losers: INTX -14%. USMO -5%. LRE -4%. CMLP -4%. HPT -4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:33 PM | 3 Comments
  • GMXRQ

    GMX Resources (GMXR) -13.9% AH after delaying its 10-K filing and saying it may seek...

    GMX Resources (GMXR) -13.9% AH after delaying its 10-K filing and saying it may seek bankruptcy protection if it is unable to reach agreement with senior debt holders in a way to restructure its finances.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:32 PM | 2 Comments
  • Z

    After opening lower in response to a soft NAHB housing index reading, Zillow (Z +4.5%) and...

    After opening lower in response to a soft NAHB housing index reading, Zillow (Z +4.5%) and Trulia (TRLA +3%) rallied, with the former making new post-IPO highs. From 12/14/12 to 2/28/13, Zillow's short interest fell from 9.4M shares to 6.5M, but the latter figures still equals 30% of its float.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM
  • ZIOP

    More on Ziopharm (NASDAQ:ZIOP): Q4 comes in-line on revenue but misses on a per shares basis....

    More on Ziopharm (NASDAQ:ZIOP): Q4 comes in-line on revenue but misses on a per shares basis. Operating expenses rose 134% over the prior year, primarily due to an $18.7M non-cash expense associated with the issuance of approximately 3.6M shares of common stock to Intrexon as a milestone payment associated with the dosing of the first patient in its Ad-RTS IL-12 Phase 2 trial. Shares -2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • FF

    Future Fuel (NYSE:FF): Q4 EPS of $0.15 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $74.6M misses by $7.6M....

    Future Fuel (NYSE:FF): Q4 EPS of $0.15 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $74.6M misses by $7.6M. Shares +1.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • CMLP

    Crestwood Midstream Partners (NYSE:CMLP) -3.7% AH after announcing a public offering of 4.5M...

    Crestwood Midstream Partners (NYSE:CMLP) -3.7% AH after announcing a public offering of 4.5M common units. CMLP says it will use the net proceeds to pay down debt and for general partnership purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • HEP

    Holly Energy Partners (NYSE:HEP) -3.4% AH after announcing a public offering of 1.875M common...

    Holly Energy Partners (NYSE:HEP) -3.4% AH after announcing a public offering of 1.875M common units. HEP intend to use net proceeds to pay down debt and for general partnership purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • INTX

    Intersections (NASDAQ:INTX): Q4 EPS of $0.08. Revenue of $84.4M (-10.3% Y/Y). Shares -18.6% AH. (PR)

    Intersections (NASDAQ:INTX): Q4 EPS of $0.08. Revenue of $84.4M (-10.3% Y/Y). Shares -18.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • OXSQ

    TICC Capital (TICC) commences a secondary offering of 3M shares vs a current float of 41.4M. Net...

    TICC Capital (TICC) commences a secondary offering of 3M shares vs a current float of 41.4M. Net asset value of Dec. 31 was $9.90, putting the stock at a 5.8% premium as of today's close. Shares -2.6% to $10.20 AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • ZIOP

    Ziopharm (NASDAQ:ZIOP): Q4 EPS of -$0.37 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $200K beats by $30K. Shares...

    Ziopharm (NASDAQ:ZIOP): Q4 EPS of -$0.37 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $200K beats by $30K. Shares -1.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • SKUL

    Skullcandy (NASDAQ:SKUL) names Hoby Darling, until now the head of Nike's (NYSE:NKE)...

    Skullcandy (NASDAQ:SKUL) names Hoby Darling, until now the head of Nike's (NYSE:NKE) fast-growing Nike+ Digital Sport unit, its new CEO, effective immediately. Darling arrives a month after former CEO Jermey Andus left to join an investment firm, and 10 days after Skullcandy shares were hammered thanks to light Q1 guidance. Investors like the hire, SKUL +3.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • TWO

    Two Harbors (NYSE:TWO) announces a Q1 dividend of $0.32/share plus a special dividend in which...

    Two Harbors (NYSE:TWO) announces a Q1 dividend of $0.32/share plus a special dividend in which spun off Silver Bay (NYSE:SBY) stock will be distributed to shareholders of record as of April 2. The company also commences a secondary offering of 50M shares, about one-sixth of the current float. Shares -2.1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • EA

    John Riccitiello is resigning as Electronic Arts' (NASDAQ:EA) CEO, and from EA's board,...

    John Riccitiello is resigning as Electronic Arts' (NASDAQ:EA) CEO, and from EA's board, effective March 30. Chairman Lawrence Probst is now executive chairman, and will run the company while it searches for Riccitiello's successor. EA is also warning it expects FQ4 (March quarter) results to be "at the low end of, or slightly below" prior guidance. The company previously forecast revenue of $1.025B-$1.125B and EPS of $0.57-$0.72; the consensus stands at $1.08B and $0.65. It looks like the Street cares more about the former news than the latter, shares +4.8% AH. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • NYMX

    Shares of Nymox Pharmaceutical (NYMX +25.2%) soar today, going out at their highs as the company...

    Shares of Nymox Pharmaceutical (NYMX +25.2%) soar today, going out at their highs as the company says it will present data on NX-1207 at the European Association of Urology's annual meeting held in Milan, Italy. NX-1207 is in late stage Phase 3 development in the U.S. for the treatment of BPH, a common condition of older men associated with growth in prostate size as men age.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • GFA-OLD

    Gafisa SA (GFA-OLD +4.3%) gains today on a likely spate of short-covering, rising for the first...

    Gafisa SA (GFA-OLD +4.3%) gains today on a likely spate of short-covering, rising for the first time since March 11, the day before the Brazilian homebuilder reported a Q4 net loss that lagged analyst forecasts. The shares are off nearly 14% since the earnings announcement.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM
  • PLX

    Protalix BioTherapeutics (PLX +2.3%) reverses morning losses to gain on news that Brazilian...

    Protalix BioTherapeutics (PLX +2.3%) reverses morning losses to gain on news that Brazilian health authorities had given regulatory approval to Uplyso, a long-term enzyme replacement therapy for adults with Type I Gaucher disease. PLX has partnered with Pfizer (PFE +0.3%) to market and commercialise the drug worldwide, apart from Israel where it maintains exclusive rights.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM
  • ADUS

    Addus Homecare (ADUS +6.3%) pops today, setting a new 52-week high after Zacks put the stock on...

    Addus Homecare (ADUS +6.3%) pops today, setting a new 52-week high after Zacks put the stock on its Rank #1 Strong Buy list. On Friday, Sidoti initiated coverage of the stock with a Buy as well.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM
  • AMAG

    Amag Pharmaceuticals (AMAG +5.6%) gains again today, setting another year high as the shares...

    Amag Pharmaceuticals (AMAG +5.6%) gains again today, setting another year high as the shares continued to benefit from Friday's release of positive preliminary data from a study on an anemia drug. The IDA-303 study focused on the safety and efficacy of repeat dosing with ferumoxytol in patients with persistent or recurring iron deficiency anemia regardless of the underlying cause and a history of unsatisfactory oral iron therapy or in whom oral iron could not be used.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • NTI

    Northern Tier Energy (NTI -2.5%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy at Cowen, which says NTI is...

    Northern Tier Energy (NTI -2.5%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy at Cowen, which says NTI is nearing fair value with the benefits of its Bakken/Canadian crude slate already embedded in current valuation and given current peak cycle conditions. Concern over the rising cost of ethanol RINs could mount in 2014 upon increased ethanol blending requirements.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM | 4 Comments
  • ADVS

    Advent Software (ADVS -3.9%) has decided to stay independent after completing a review of...

    Advent Software (ADVS -3.9%) has decided to stay independent after completing a review of strategic alternatives, the company announces. Shares are lower, but have bounced off their morning lows. They soared last week after Reuters reported Frank Quattrone had been hired to help find a buyer. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • CWT

    California Water Service (CWT -1.8%) dips today after earlier announcing a 5M share secondary...

    California Water Service (CWT -1.8%) dips today after earlier announcing a 5M share secondary offering. Robert Baird and Wells Fargo Securities will act as joint book running managers. The company plans to use the proceeds for investment in subsidiaries, acquisitions and other various general corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • HPR

    Bill Barrett's (BBG +6.2%) move to allow some institutional shareholders to hold up to 20% of...

    Bill Barrett's (BBG +6.2%) move to allow some institutional shareholders to hold up to 20% of its stock, up from 15%, without trying to take over the company "adds large incremental buyers potentially," Wunderlich says. Also boosting shares is a presentation noting a new Colorado well result from a competitor; after investor skepticism, the news "makes [BBG] look a little more de-risked," SunTrust says.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • HSP

    Hospira (HSP -1.8%) says the FDA's granted pediatric exclusivity for it's alpha-2 agonist...

    Hospira (HSP -1.8%) says the FDA's granted pediatric exclusivity for it's alpha-2 agonist Precedex injection. The decision extends generic exculsivity by a period of six months after patent expiry. 

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • CAT

    Caterpillar (CAT +0.8%) bucks a weak tape after ISI reiterated its Strong Buy rating earlier...

    Caterpillar (CAT +0.8%) bucks a weak tape after ISI reiterated its Strong Buy rating earlier today, albeit shaved its price target marginally from $120 to $119. ISI says that despite the strong performance of the machinery sector, investors are currently girding themselves for "buy in May and go away," but once the calendar risk goes away CAT should handily outperform.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM | 2 Comments
  • CNVR

    A Jefferies upgrade and a bullish coverage launch from Lake Street Capital lead ValueClick (VCLK...

    A Jefferies upgrade and a bullish coverage launch from Lake Street Capital lead ValueClick (VCLK +10.6%) to soar to new post-financial crisis highs. Jefferies' Brian Fitzgerald praises new CEO John Giuliani for improving ValueClick's focus, and considers the online ad services firm's 200M-user database a major asset. He also considers mobile ads a key growth opportunity.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • PAY

    VeriFone (PAY +3.5%) appoints Eliezer Yanay, the head of its R&D, supply chain, and product...

    VeriFone (PAY +3.5%) appoints Eliezer Yanay, the head of its R&D, supply chain, and product management efforts, to the newly-created position of COO. The company has also named three regional heads for the Americas and EMEA. Investors are taking kindly to the moves, much as they did to last week's removal of CEO Douglas Berenson. VeriFone has blamed its recent woes in large part on sales execution and R&D issues.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • RPRX

    Repros Therapeutics (RPRX -2.9%) trades down after its Q4 per share loss comes in wider than...

    Repros Therapeutics (RPRX -2.9%) trades down after its Q4 per share loss comes in wider than expected, primarily due to increased expenses in clinical development related to Androxal and Proellex and higher operational expenses. R&D expenses also increased 54% to approximately $13.3M, as compared to $8.7M for the same period in the prior year. 

     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM
  • LDK

    Chinese solar stocks are selling off following (widely-expected) news of Suntech's default, and...

    Chinese solar stocks are selling off following (widely-expected) news of Suntech's default, and reports the Chinese government may soon cut solar electricity subsidies. The latter is potentially a major problem given how weak European demand and trade disputes have made the domestic solar market more important than ever. LDK -9.1%. SOL -10.2%. DQ -7%. YGE -6.9%. JASO -3.7%. CSIQ -3.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • YRCW

    Midday top 10 gainers: YRCW +25%. PRWT +22%. ULTR +17%. IG +17%. CHYR +16%. ATOS +14%. TA +13%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: YRCW +25%. PRWT +22%. ULTR +17%. IG +17%. CHYR +16%. ATOS +14%. TA +13%. NYMX +13%. WILC +11%. SORL +11%.
    Midday top 10 losers: AMBO -19%. PTX -12%. SOL -10%. CNET -10%. EMITF -9%. TSEM -8%. MNDO -8%. OTC:RGDX -8%. JVA -8%. AMBA -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • CHTR

    Shares of Charter Communications (CHTR +8.4%) are under a trading halt after jetting higher on...

    Shares of Charter Communications (CHTR +8.4%) are under a trading halt after jetting higher on reports of a potential purchase by Liberty Media (LMCA -1%) of a sizable stake in the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • YRCW

    YRC Worldwide (YRCW +24.1%) pop after the markets digests a number of steps the company took...

    YRC Worldwide (YRCW +24.1%) pop after the markets digests a number of steps the company took last week to consolidate its networks and potentially lay off workers.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM | 2 Comments
  • AMD

    The Street isn't appreciating the value of AMD's (AMD +2.5%) game console ops, argues...

    The Street isn't appreciating the value of AMD's (AMD +2.5%) game console ops, argues Macquarie's Shawn Webster while upgrading shares to Outperform. Backing out Macquarie's console chip sales forecast from the Street's AMD estimates implies a consensus of flat growth for AMD's core businesses in Q3 and a 5% drop in Q4 - Webster considers those forecasts too bearish. AMD CPUs and GPUs having been designed into the PlayStation 4 and (from all indications) the Xbox 720.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM | 3 Comments
  • SEEL

    Apricus Biosciences (APRI -4%) slips today after the company gives an update on corporate...

    Apricus Biosciences (APRI -4%) slips today after the company gives an update on corporate activities and announces it's appointed Richard Pascoe, a 20-year veteran in the biopharmaceutical industry, as its new CEO as the company begins development and marketing of Vitaros and Femprox.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • INCY

    Brean Murray defends Incyte (INCY -8.3%) following the news that a UK patient taking Jakafi...

    Brean Murray defends Incyte (INCY -8.3%) following the news that a UK patient taking Jakafi developed PML. Brean says the patient had been taking the drug for only three months, and is not likely related to the infection. Analyst Jonathan Aschoff notes that, "Even Tysabri had no cases of PML within the first eight months of therapy."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • AVGO

    Samsung's Galaxy S IV uses a Broadcom (BRCM +0.9%) NFC chip rather than an NXP (NXPI -3.3%)...

    Samsung's Galaxy S IV uses a Broadcom (BRCM +0.9%) NFC chip rather than an NXP (NXPI -3.3%) part, NFC Times confirms in a column that seems to be pressuring NXP shares - some already suspected a Broadcom chip is being used. The site adds Broadcom's part works in tandem with an STMicroelectronics (STM +3.8%) memory chip to enable NFC payment apps from Visa and MasterCard. NXP supplies the NFC chip found in the Galaxy S III and is still the market's leading vendor, but Broadcom's design win rate has been picking up lately.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM | 1 Comment
  • GLUU

    Northland jumps on board the Glu Mobile (GLUU +12.9%) bandwagon, upgrading shares to Outperform...

    Northland jumps on board the Glu Mobile (GLUU +12.9%) bandwagon, upgrading shares to Outperform in the wake of last week's huge online gambling-fueled rally. Analyst Darren Aftahi claims smartphone game sales are beating expectations, and that Glu is seeing a higher percentage of hit titles with its latest releases. Northland downgraded Glu on Feb. 1, when shares were 22% below Friday's close.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM

  • Gold's safe-haven status is renewed amid the situation in Cyprus, sending Comex gold above...

    Gold's safe-haven status is renewed amid the situation in Cyprus, sending Comex gold above $1,600/oz. for the first time this month. “Gold should profit from the possibility that savings are no longer regarded as safe," Commerzbank says, but it's too early to know if the push will last; Societe Generale doubts gold rallies much from here. Gold miners also move up: GDX +1.1%, GDXJ +1.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM | 3 Comments
  • INCY

    Incyte (INCY -7.9%) slips today after disclosing that a UK patient taking its bone-marrow drug...

    Incyte (INCY -7.9%) slips today after disclosing that a UK patient taking its bone-marrow drug Jakafi died of a rare brain infection. The company says it's unclear whether Jakafi caused the infection and that it's the only reported case among nearly 10K people who've taken the drug.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM | 1 Comment
  • HZNP

    Horizon Pharma (HZNP -4.2%) slides after Q4 results beat on a per share basis but missed on...

    Horizon Pharma (HZNP -4.2%) slides after Q4 results beat on a per share basis but missed on revenue, despite a 91% jump in total sales Y/Y. Duexis net sales were $6M, representing 90% of total net sales during the quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • HPQ

    An upgrade to Overweight from Morgan Stanley's Katy Huberty leads H-P (HPQ +2.7%) to touch...

    An upgrade to Overweight from Morgan Stanley's Katy Huberty leads H-P (HPQ +2.7%) to touch levels last seen in spring 2012. Huberty praises Meg Whitman for getting execs to "consider free cash flow implications" for their moves (as compared with a traditional focus on revenue/EPS), and thinks lower capex and an improved cash conversion cycle could lead to $3.45/share in annual free cash flow, $1/share better than what management has been forecasting. H-P has now roughly doubled from its Nov. '12 low.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM | 8 Comments
  • HP

    Helmerich & Payne (HP -3.7%) is the biggest loser in the S&P 500 after the contract...

    Helmerich & Payne (HP -3.7%) is the biggest loser in the S&P 500 after the contract driller says its operational outlook for Q2 is unchanged and its active rig count remains flat in a presentation for Howard Weil's energy conference. Pricing currently remains strong yet is also "under downward pressure" as competitors are aggressively pricing rigs to recapture market share.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • SLS

    Galena Biopharma (GALE +3.4%) gains after saying its entered into an agreement with Swedish drug...

    Galena Biopharma (GALE +3.4%) gains after saying its entered into an agreement with Swedish drug maker Orexo AB to acquire Abstral Sublingual Tablets for sale and distribution in the United States. Abstral was approved by the FDA in January 2011, and had $54M in sales in Europe in 2012. Under the terms of the agreement, GALE will pay Orexo $10M upfront and $5M within the first twelve months of closing, plus low double digit royalties and one-time milestone payments based on pre-specified net sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • BCEI

    Price targets for Bonanza Creek Energy (BCEI +3.4%) are raised by at least three firms,...

    Price targets for Bonanza Creek Energy (BCEI +3.4%) are raised by at least three firms, including Societe Generale's boost to $43 from $26 after the company turned in a strong quarter with robust volume growth and declining operating costs. BCEI continues to deliver encouraging flow rates from the Wattenberg field; overall proved reserves grew 21% in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • BTU

    A rumor that Carl Icahn has picked up an activist position in Peabody Energy (BTU +3%) is behind...

    A rumor that Carl Icahn has picked up an activist position in Peabody Energy (BTU +3%) is behind early gains; Icahn already has been plenty busy recently with his dalliances in Dell and Transocean. Shares also are upgraded by Nomura, which believes cost pressures facing BTU are largely well known by the market and the company can achieve improved unit costs in H2.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM | 4 Comments
  • ISRG

    Intuitive Surgical (ISRG +4.2%) gets a lift today after Canaccord upgraded the shares to Buy on...

    Intuitive Surgical (ISRG +4.2%) gets a lift today after Canaccord upgraded the shares to Buy on valuation, but lowers its price target to $527 from $590. The firm says that the target reduction stems from adjusting its P/E/G multiple to bring it in line with comps, but even with the reduced target that still leaves the stock with 10% - 15% upside potential and justifies an upgrade.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM | 3 Comments
  • ARO

    Retail buzz: Aeropostale (ARO +3%) looks attractive to P-E firms, according to Wall Street...

    Retail buzz: Aeropostale (ARO +3%) looks attractive to P-E firms, according to Wall Street analysts. The retailer generates plenty of cash flow and is relatively debt-free. With current management seen as under-performing a bit, a takeover offer of as much as $20 a share (45% premium) could come down the pike.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • UNG

    Natural gas is threatening $4/MBTUs for the first time in 17 months as winter has shown no sign...

    Natural gas is threatening $4/MBTUs for the first time in 17 months as winter has shown no sign of exiting and MDA Weather Services is predicting lower-than-normal temps for most of the country for the rest of the month. "We could see three more weeks of (storage) withdrawals" at a time when most are positioned for additions, says an analyst. UNG +2.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM | 9 Comments
  • SLB

    Schlumberger (SLB -2.4%) warns that North American activity is coming in weaker than expected in...

    Schlumberger (SLB -2.4%) warns that North American activity is coming in weaker than expected in Q1, with fewer rigs going back to work. Asset utilization has recovered from a holiday slowdown and lower cost for guar, a key ingredient used in fracking, is providing some relief, but pricing remains the fundamental issue, CEO Paul Kibsgaard tells an energy conference. HAL -1.5%, BHI -2%, WFT -1.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • NWBO

    Northwest Biotherapeutics (OTCQB:NWBO +7%) trades up this morning after being issued a patent by...

    Northwest Biotherapeutics (OTCQB:NWBO +7%) trades up this morning after being issued a patent by the USPTO covering processes for manufacturing human dendritic cells. The process focuses on producing pure dendritic cells, which are much more potent in their capacity to activate the immune system than those produced by the standard methods used throughout academia and industry today.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • MU

    Susquehanna thinks it's time to take profits on Micron (MU -2.5%), cutting the memory maker to...

    Susquehanna thinks it's time to take profits on Micron (MU -2.5%), cutting the memory maker to Negative following a 70%+ rally. The firm thinks DRAM fundamentals are peaking following major price increases, and expects blended ASPs to start dropping next month. The downgrade comes shortly after RBC argued SanDisk (SNDK -1%) is a better near-term play than Micron (while calling Micron better long-term), citing a favorable supply/demand balance for NAND flash (thanks partly to Samsung phone demand) and Micron's "execution risks."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM | 2 Comments
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (JCP +5.4%) turns higher with the word on the street that weekend sales for Joe...

    J.C. Penney (JCP +5.4%) turns higher with the word on the street that weekend sales for Joe Fresh lines were solid. The brand is the latest boutique shops idea to spring up at the retailer and by most accounts one of the most promising. (Also: ISI Group pitches REIT play for JCP)
